name: parameter list
SOAP XML (read)
Extract value
time interval
info:
# time interval
Define the time interval to repeat the list of parameters.
Be sure that the number of parameters
can be processed in the time frame,
which is set with the limiter.

name: parameter list
info:
# parameter list
The parameter list translate the ioBroker names to web2com IDs.
For example, the value for the object "heat_pipe_status" in the subfolder "web2com"
of the node-red folder will be mapped to the ID "/1/2/1/125/0".
`"web2com/heat_pipe_status": "/1/2/1/125/0"`
Remove or add lines, depending on your local needs.
You can find the IDs (numbers in brackets before each value) 
in the web2com user interface.
Be sure that the line ends with a comma, 
but not the last line in the list.

name: limiter
info:
# limiter
Use the limiter, to limit the number of request per seconds
to avoid an overload of the web2com interface.

name: SOAP XML
info:
# SOAP XML
The node embeds the ID into a SOAP XML for the web2com interface.

name: http request
info:
# http request
Send an HTTP request to the web2com interface.
Set the IP number, username and password for local needs.
Depending on the software revision of the web2com interface
you must adapt the authentication method.
This can be "Basic" or "Digest".

name: xml
info:
# xml
Convert the HTTP result in an XML structure.

name: Extract value
info:
# Extract value
Extract the result value from the XML structure.

name: The user of this interface is responsible not to damage the heat pump with misleading parameters.
HA sensor
info:
# HA sensor
Provide the data as HA sensor
